lexUnit.name: compliment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a polite expression of praise or admiration.

sentence.text: He knew Blanche was nervous by her uncharacteristic air of distraction and tried to calm her with compliments about her appearance .
They received a rare compliment from the enemy themselves .
She was not used to receiving compliments from men in public .
She has decided that pretty compliments from members of the opposite sex are what , after all , is important in this life .
( When Leonard came to write his second novel , he paid MacLennan the finest compliment of all -- and the riskiest -- by imitating his theme , as we shall see . )
Flattery conceals greed , and marriage will bring a hard realization to women who readily believe the compliments of their suitors or , indeed , their promises of fidelity .
Chomping a guarana chewing gum , he bashfully accepts the compliments of a rather old-looking female fan .
This is n't a complaint , it 's a compliment on the new look .
She respected her stepdaughter 's position as Princess of Wales , always curtsied and paid her compliments on her looks and her outfits .

He passed one or two cool and entirely acceptable compliments on her appearance , and contrived to make her feel a charming and desirable woman without in any way ruffling her sensibilities by an excess of ardour .
There she 'd been , aching for a night of passion and the best he 'd felt moved to offer her was a compliment on her dancing !
He found that he could pay a compliment to Charles Raven , from whom he was so sadly sundered in spirit , for his book on Religion and Science .
It 's a great compliment to her .
Cultured gents , identified for me by Mackie as being the Himalayan peaks of the Jockey Club , paid compliments to Tremayne from an adjacent table and bowed low to the sponsor .
Indeed a tremendous compliment to the band , and manager Scott Piering welcomed the exercise .
But perhaps the most kindly and satisfying compliment to the Cornish was paid by one of the earliest tourists , John Taylor , in 1649
There is no country better at patriotism than the U.S. and its treatment of the match should be taken as a compliment to European golf .
My compliments , child , on your cooking .
` After all , you already know just how rare my compliments are , do n't you , Robyn ?
Leeds manager Howard Wilkinson made the compliment in the wake of Palace 's battling mid-week Coca-Cola Cup victory over Liverpool .
Lucille scorned that compliment with a grimace , then gave Sharpe a warning look .
Samantha takes the compliments with a shrug and a giggle .
Milton is paying to Eden the highest compliment in his power .
Shelley gave him a smile that deflated his compliment without being ungracious .
The greatest compliment Mark Knopfler ever paid me was in a magazine when he was asked to list the members of Dire straits .
I 'll take that as a compliment
People can be very shy about giving compliments .
He was n't paying her a compliment .
` That sounds a back-handed compliment ! "
